info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:59PM MDT until June 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT/430 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO...SOUTHWESTERN CHEYENNE AND NORTHWESTERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 257 PM MDT/357 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Kanorado, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. Spotters reported 1-2 inches of accumulating hail on Highway 385 10 miles north of Burlington. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Stratton, Kanorado, Ruleton and Bethune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 421 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 184 and 205, and near mile marker 211. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
